com.atakmap.android.maps.tilesets.mobac

Class QueryLayers

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.atakmap.android.maps.tilesets.mobac.QueryLayers
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    WMSQueryLayers, WMTSQueryLayers

    public abstract class QueryLayers
extends java.lang.Object

    Class to query a web map server's GetCapabilities function and provide metadata about the layers it serves.

    To use this class, first instantiate a new object, then call process(). If process() returns successfully, then metadata about the layers and the server itself may be queried using getLayers(), getServerName(), etc.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes

      static class  QueryLayers.Style
      Class to encapsulate a layer style.

    • Method Detail

      • getBaseURL

        public java.net.URL getBaseURL()
        Return the URL that this object was created with.

      • getLayers

        public java.util.List<WebMapLayer> getLayers()
        Return the list of layers provided by this map server. Since Layer objects may contain children, this list may form a recursive tree structure. This method should only be called after a successful call to process().

      • getServiceTitle

        public java.lang.String getServiceTitle()
        Return the human-readable title of this map server.

      • getMimeTypes

        public java.util.Set<java.lang.String> getMimeTypes()
        Return the list of map imagery formats this map server provides, in mime-type form (e.g. "image/jpeg"). This method should only be called after a successful call to process().

      • getGetMapURL

        public java.lang.String getGetMapURL()
        Return the URL string that should be used for this map server's GetMap calls.

      • isProcessed

        public boolean isProcessed()
        Returns true if process() has been called successfully. Many functions on this class return undefined results if isProcessed() returns false.

      • process

        public abstract void process()
                      throws java.io.IOException
        Actually perform the query of the map server. An exception will be thrown in case of any failure. This function performs network access.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - in case of error.
